section.title: Freestyle Functions (freestyle.functions)
section.paragraph: This module contains functions operating on vertices (0D elements) and polylines (1D elements). The module is also intended to be a collection of examples for function definition in Python.
User-defined functions inherit one of the following base classes, depending on the object type (0D or 1D) to operate on and the return value type:

desc_content.paragraph: Sets the chaining time stamp of the Interface1D.

Returns a real value giving the 2D curvature (as an angle) of the 1D element to which the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator belongs. The 2D curvature is evaluated at the Interface0D.

field_body.paragraph: The 2D curvature of the 1D element evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the 2D curvature as an angle for an Interface1D.
A replacement of the built-in MaterialF0D for stroke creation. MaterialF0D does not work with Curves and Strokes. Line color priority is used to pick one of the two materials at material boundaries.

definition_list_item.term: Notes: expects instances of CurvePoint to be iterated over

definition.paragraph: can return None if no fedge can be found

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the freestyle.types.Nature of the 1D element the Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator belongs to.

field_body.paragraph: The nature of the 1D element to which the pointed Interface0D belongs.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the nature of the Interface1D (silhouette, ridge, crease, and so on). Except if the Interface1D is a freestyle.types.ViewEdge, this result might be ambiguous. Indeed, the Interface1D might result from the gathering of several 1D elements, each one being of a different nature. An integration method, such as the MEAN, might give, in this case, irrelevant results.

field_body.paragraph: sigma (float) – The gaussian sigma value indicating the X value for which the gaussian function is 0.5. It leads to the window size value (the larger, the smoother).

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the density of the (result) image evaluated at the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator. This density is evaluated using a pixels square window around the evaluation point and integrating these values using a gaussian.

field_body.paragraph: The density of the image evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.

list_item.paragraph: sigma (float) – The sigma used in DensityF0D and determining the window size used in each density query.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

sampling (float) – The resolution used to sample the chain: the corresponding 0D function is evaluated at each sample point and the result is obtained by combining the resulting values into a single one, following the method specified by integration_type.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the density evaluated for an Interface1D. The density is evaluated for a set of points along the Interface1D (using the freestyle.functions.DensityF0D functor) with a user-defined sampling and then integrated into a single value using a user-defined integration method.

field_body.paragraph: The density evaluated for an Interface1D.

list_item.paragraph: level (int) – The level of the pyramid from which the pixel must be read.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

sampling (float) – The resolution used to sample the chain: the corresponding 0D function is evaluated at each sample point and the result is obtained by combining the resulting values into a single one, following the method specified by integration_type.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the density evaluated for an Interface1D in the complete viewmap image. The density is evaluated for a set of points along the Interface1D (using the freestyle.functions.ReadCompleteViewMapPixelF0D functor) and then integrated into a single value using a user-defined integration method.

field_body.paragraph: The density evaluated for the Interface1D in the complete viewmap image.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the curvilinear abscissa of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator in the context of its 1D element.

field_body.paragraph: The curvilinear abscissa of the pointed Interface0D.

list_item.paragraph: orientation (int) – The number of the directional map we must work with.
level (int) – The level of the pyramid from which the pixel must be read.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

sampling (float) – The resolution used to sample the chain: the corresponding 0D function is evaluated at each sample point and the result is obtained by combining the resulting values into a single one, following the method specified by integration_type.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the density evaluated for an Interface1D in of the steerable viewmaps image. The direction telling which Directional map to choose is explicitly specified by the user. The density is evaluated for a set of points along the Interface1D (using the freestyle.functions.ReadSteerableViewMapPixelF0D functor) and then integrated into a single value using a user-defined integration method.

field_body.paragraph: the density evaluated for an Interface1D in of the steerable viewmaps image.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the freestyle.types.ViewShape that the Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator occludes.

field_body.paragraph: The ViewShape occluded by the pointed Interface0D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a list of occluded shapes covered by this Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: A list of occluded shapes covered by the Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a list of freestyle.types.ViewShape objects occluding the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator.

field_body.paragraph: A list of ViewShape objects occluding the pointed Interface0D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a list of occluding shapes that cover this Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: A list of occluding shapes that cover the Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the parameter of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator in the context of its 1D element.
Returns the X 3D projected coordinate of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator.

field_body.paragraph: The X 3D projected coordinate of the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the projected X 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: The projected X 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the Y 3D projected coordinate of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator.

field_body.paragraph: The Y 3D projected coordinate of the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the projected Y 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: The projected Y 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the Z 3D projected coordinate of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator.

field_body.paragraph: The Z 3D projected coordinate of the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the projected Z 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: The projected Z 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the freestyle.types.ViewShape containing the Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator.

field_body.paragraph: The ViewShape containing the pointed Interface0D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a list of shapes covered by this Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: A list of shapes covered by the Interface1D.

list_item.paragraph: level (int) – The level of the pyramid from which the pixel must be read.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

sampling (float) – The resolution used to sample the chain: the corresponding 0D function is evaluated at each sample point and the result is obtained by combining the resulting values into a single one, following the method specified by integration_type.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the density of the ViewMap for a given Interface1D. The density of each freestyle.types.FEdge is evaluated in the proper steerable freestyle.types.ViewMap depending on its orientation.

field_body.paragraph: The density of the ViewMap for a given Interface1D.
level (int) – The level of the pyramid from which the pixel must be read.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the norm of the gradient of the global viewmap density image.

field_body.paragraph: The norm of the gradient of the global viewmap density image.

list_item.paragraph: level (int) – The level of the pyramid from which the pixel must be read.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

sampling (float) – The resolution used to sample the chain: the corresponding 0D function is evaluated at each sample point and the result is obtained by combining the resulting values into a single one, following the method specified by integration_type.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the density of the ViewMap for a given Interface1D. The density of each freestyle.types.FEdge is evaluated in the proper steerable freestyle.types.ViewMap depending on its orientation.

field_body.paragraph: The density of the ViewMap for a given Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the X 3D coordinate of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator.

field_body.paragraph: The X 3D coordinate of the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the X 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: The X 3D coordinate of the Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the Y 3D coordinate of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator.

field_body.paragraph: The Y 3D coordinate of the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the Y 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: The Y 3D coordinate of the Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the Z 3D coordinate of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator.

field_body.paragraph: The Z 3D coordinate of the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the Z 3D coordinate of an Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: The Z 3D coordinate of the Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Increments the chaining time stamp of the Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: mask_size (float) – The size of the mask.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the average depth around the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator. The result is obtained by querying the depth buffer on a window around that point.

field_body.paragraph: The average depth around the pointed Interface0D.

list_item.paragraph: sigma (float) – The sigma used in DensityF0D and determining the window size used in each density query.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the average depth evaluated for an Interface1D. The average depth is evaluated for a set of points along the Interface1D (using the freestyle.functions.LocalAverageDepthF0D functor) with a user-defined sampling and then integrated into a single value using a user-defined integration method.

field_body.paragraph: The average depth evaluated for the Interface1D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the material of the object evaluated at the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator. This evaluation can be ambiguous (in the case of a freestyle.types.TVertex for example. This functor tries to remove this ambiguity using the context offered by the 1D element to which the Interface0DIterator belongs to and by arbitrary choosing the material of the face that lies on its left when following the 1D element if there are two different materials on each side of the point. However, there still can be problematic cases, and the user willing to deal with this cases in a specific way should implement its own getMaterial functor.

field_body.paragraph: The material of the object evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a two-dimensional vector giving the normalized 2D normal to the 1D element to which the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator belongs. The normal is evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.

field_body.paragraph: The 2D normal of the 1D element evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the 2D normal for the Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the 2D orientation of the Interface1D.

field_body.paragraph: integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the 3D orientation of the Interface1D.

Returns the quantitative invisibility of the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator. This evaluation can be ambiguous (in the case of a freestyle.types.TVertex for example). This functor tries to remove this ambiguity using the context offered by the 1D element to which the Interface0D belongs to. However, there still can be problematic cases, and the user willing to deal with this cases in a specific way should implement its own getQIF0D functor.

field_body.paragraph: The quantitative invisibility of the pointed Interface0D.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the Quantitative Invisibility of an Interface1D element. If the Interface1D is a freestyle.types.ViewEdge, then there is no ambiguity concerning the result. But, if the Interface1D results of a chaining (chain, stroke), then it might be made of several 1D elements of different Quantitative Invisibilities.

field_body.paragraph: The Quantitative Invisibility of the Interface1D.
level (int) – The level of the pyramid from which the pixel must be read.

desc_content.paragraph: Reads a pixel in one of the level of the complete viewmap.

field_body.paragraph: A pixel in one of the level of the complete viewmap.

list_item.paragraph: map_name (str) – The name of the map to be read.
level (int) – The level of the pyramid from which the pixel must be read.

desc_content.paragraph: Reads a pixel in a map.

list_item.paragraph: orientation (int) – The integer belonging to [0, 4] indicating the orientation (E, NE, N, NW) we are interested in.
level (int) – The level of the pyramid from which the pixel must be read.

desc_content.paragraph: Reads a pixel in one of the level of one of the steerable viewmaps.

field_body.paragraph: A pixel in one of the level of one of the steerable viewmaps.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the freestyle.types.Id of the Shape the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator belongs to. This evaluation can be ambiguous (in the case of a freestyle.types.TVertex for example). This functor tries to remove this ambiguity using the context offered by the 1D element to which the Interface0DIterator belongs to. However, there still can be problematic cases, and the user willing to deal with this cases in a specific way should implement its own getShapeIdF0D functor.

field_body.paragraph: The Id of the Shape the pointed Interface0D belongs to.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the time stamp of the Interface1D.

Returns a two-dimensional vector giving the 2D oriented tangent to the 1D element to which the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator belongs. The 2D oriented tangent is evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.

field_body.paragraph: The 2D oriented tangent to the 1D element evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a three-dimensional vector giving the 3D oriented tangent to the 1D element to which the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator belongs. The 3D oriented tangent is evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.

field_body.paragraph: The 3D oriented tangent to the 1D element evaluated at the pointed Interface0D.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a real value giving the distance between the freestyle.types.Interface0D pointed by the Interface0DIterator and the shape that lies behind (occludee). This distance is evaluated in the camera space and normalized between 0 and 1. Therefore, if no object is occluded by the shape to which the Interface0D belongs to, 1 is returned.

field_body.paragraph: The normalized distance between the pointed Interface0D and the occludee.
integration_type (freestyle.types.IntegrationType) – The integration method used to compute a single value from a set of values.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a real value giving the distance between an Interface1D and the shape that lies behind (occludee). This distance is evaluated in the camera space and normalized between 0 and 1. Therefore, if no object is occluded by the shape to which the Interface1D belongs to, 1 is returned.

field_body.paragraph: The normalized distance between the Interface1D and the occludee.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the gradient vector for a pixel.

field_body.paragraph: level (int) – the level at which to compute the gradient
